conclusion: To determine if the two cars will collide, I will analyze the velocity-time graphs of the car and the truck. I will calculate the time it takes for the car to stop and compare it to the time it takes for the truck to cover the 30-meter distance.

premise: The car starts at 30 m/s and follows graph a. The car's velocity decreases over time, eventually reaching 0 m/s.
conclusion: The car's velocity decreases over time, eventually reaching 0 m/s.

premise: The truck travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s, as shown by graph b.
conclusion: The truck travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s.

premise: The car needs to stop before the truck reaches it.
conclusion: The time it takes for the car to stop can be found by analyzing graph a.

premise: The truck travels 30 meters at 10 m/s.
conclusion: The time taken for the truck to cover this distance is 30 meters / 10 m/s = 3 seconds.

premise: If the car stops before 3 seconds, they will not collide. Otherwise, they will collide.
conclusion: By examining graph a, the car stops before 3 seconds, indicating that they will not collide.
